column4: Hey everyone.. I was having a problem connecting my windows x server to my ubuntu machine, but I discovered it was caused by the particular firewall software on windows.  I figured I'd post the info on the ubuntu site for the benefit of others.. my question is: where is the approriate place to post this?
windows X server? you mean XWin32?
Yes, a windows X server.  I'm connecting to a ubuntu virtual machine running on vmware.  The server I'm running is called Xmins.
hmm, not sure, try checking on the forum first to see if anyone has found a solution, and maybe if not, you can try and ask to see if you can post it up and if so, where
Okay.. good idea
are you on dapper?
I'm running 5.10 if that's what you mean
hmm hoary.. and I don't see how the icons could go missing, is it a fresh install?
It runs fine locally, the icons are only missing when running the remote x server
not sure, it might be an issue with the rendering via VMWare or something
well then I'm not too sure about it :/
Strangely enough, it's the (slow) vmware desktop that runs it fine, and only the (fast) x server that shows up strange.. but thanks for the help anyways
could it be an issue with the remote client? I mean the software?
hm.. yes, that's a really good point.. I should try a different one.
I know there is a commercial one called XWin32, tried on 2 different linux distros and it seemed to render fine
okay.. I'll try the demo for that and see how that works
Wow, that's old.. my first every computer had that :)
heh, it was fine at certain res but I was sure that it could do much better than having very small amount of resolution
any luck with XWin32?
ok, coolies
Thanks man.. you were right.  Running XWin32 fixes the display glitches.
np
And sorry.. it had nothing to do with linux after all
well that shouldn't be a problem but anyway :)
